file_content.text: I have no need for you currently. Be on your way.
So, the Jedi is preparing his escape. You did well. Not perfectly, but I have confidence the operation will succeed.
Our business is concluded. I will make note of your assistance in my report.
I'm glad to help.
As it should be.
What about the Jedi? Will he be safe?
Is Quorian going to be okay?
No Jedi is safe. Sooner or later, the Empire will destroy the order entirely.
I don't need your praise.
Whatever.
No. I imagine you don't.
Take these tokens as payment for your service--and know that no Jedi can threaten Korriban. Now, go.
Do not waste my time while the Jedi remains imprisoned.
I have need of you, young one. Whatever errand your master sent you on can wait until we are through.
Very well.
What gives you the right to command me?
Says who?
My master would smite you for your impudence.
I don't think so.
Then your master is a fool.
My master can rot, for all I care.
I'm sick of errands anyway.
Then it's time you had some direction.
I am Inquisitor Urinth, and I represent the Intelligence operations of the Sith.
We are currently holding an important Jedi prisoner. A spy who attempted to reach this Academy. We have plans for him.
What kind of plans?
Plans?
The only "plans" we should be making for Jedi is how to execute them.
He should die.
That is not your judgment to make.
Have you hurt him?
Is he okay?
Only enough to be convincing--the permanent damage is minimal.
Upon capture, we found the Jedi's mind simple to manipulate. We fed him false memories through a combination of drugs and sorcery.
Soon, he will return to his Jedi commanders and report the lies we fed him. He will know nothing of what we've done. All that remains is to stage his escape.
And once he's free, what will he tell the Jedi? What did you plant on him?
What's the plan?
Information that should encourage certain Outer Rim colonies to reduce their defenses. Once that happens, we can arrange the destruction of those colonies and their Jedi defenders.
Sounds tricky.
I can do it.
Good. I'm pleased that you appreciate our project.
You are young enough, new enough, to be a plausible traitor. You will go to the Jedi. Talk to him. Do as he asks. Earn his trust.
When that is done, set him free. Do whatever is necessary to get him out of prison. We will ensure that he reaches his ship and returns safely to his Jedi friends.
Understood.
How do I know you won't accuse me of treason?
I won't get in trouble?
Prove your strength--prove that you are truly Sith--and all the accusations in the world will mean nothing.
Not my business.
No? Let me be clear--refuse me, and you refuse the will of the Empire. Your apprenticeship to the Sith does not give you limitless freedom.
Of course--there must have been a misunderstanding.
I see.
If I must, then.
You will find the Jedi Quorian Dorjis in the jail cells. He is still confused and should not be overly difficult to convince.
Now, go. I expect you to fulfill your duty to the Empire.
I'm not working for you, inquisitor.
I'm out. [Refuse quest]
Then we have nothing more to discuss.
I have no need for you right now.
This isn't a place for non-Sith.
